Controlling Items Displayed in Comparisons

In the View Comparison Utility, the icons that appear in the item pane show the relationships between the displayed source and target items (as explained below). The icons on the left represent the items in the source view, and the icons on the right represent the corresponding items in the target view.

The application sorts the items in the item pane by merge status, then by source item descriptor (such as the file name or change request number). If all items are displayed, the list will sort them in the following order:

  • Items in both views that do not need to be merged, sorted by descriptor.

  • Items in the source view that do need to be merged, sorted by descriptor.

  • Items in the target view that do need to be merged, sorted by descriptor.

  • Items in both views that do need to be merged, sorted by descriptor.

  • Items only in the source view, sorted by descriptor.

  • Items only in the target view, sorted by descriptor.

Within each icon group, items are in ASCII order.

To change the type of items that display in the item pane:

Select the Folders tab or a component tab from the lower pane of the View Comparison window.

To filter the displayed items:

  1. Do one of the following:

    • From the Item or context menu, select Display.

    • Use the Display drop-down list box on the toolbar.

  2. Select the set of items to be displayed:

    • All Items: Displays all items that are in the source, target, or both folders.

    • All Items With Differences: Displays all items except those that show two pieces of blank paper, side-by-side.

    • All Items Needing Merge: Displays all items that can be merged.

    • Source Items Needing Merge: Displays only items that have changed in the target view and can be merged into the source view.

    • Target Items Needing Merge: Displays only the items that have changed in the source view and can be merged into the target view.

    • All Items In Both Views: Displays the items that are in both the source and target folders.

    • All Items Not In Both Views: Displays the items that are in only one view.

    • Items Only in Source View: Displays items in the source folder that are missing from the target folder.

    • Items Only in Target View: Displays items in the target folder that are missing from the source folder.

Note: The Item > Display menu offers the same options as the Item > Select menu. In addition it has the Use Merge Tracking for Merge Resolution option, which affects both the items that display and those you can select.
